wikipedia_page.main: Dee Hepburn (born 7 November 1961) is a Scottish former actress. She starred as Dorothy in the 1981 film Gregory's Girl, and played Anne-Marie Wade in the ITV soap opera Crossroads from 1985 to 1988.

response: *Dee Hepburn – actress, best known for her role in Gregory's Girl
* Dee Hepburn (born 1961), a Scottish former actress

Gregory's Girl is a 1981 Scottish coming-of-age romantic comedy film written and directed by Bill Forsyth and starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn and Clare Grogan. The film is set in and around a state secondary school in the Abronhill district of Cumbernauld.

Gregory Underwood (John Gordon Sinclair) is an awkward teenager who plays in his school football team. They are not doing very well, so the coach (Jake D'Arcy) holds a trial to find new players. Dorothy (Dee Hepburn) shows up and, despite the coach's sexist misgivings, proves to be a very good player. She subsequently takes Gregory's place as centre forward, and Gregory in turn replaces his friend Andy (Robert Buchanan) as goalkeeper.
* Variety Club actress of the year award, Dee Hepburn, 1981
She was played by Dee Hepburn in the 1996 film The Bruce.
|Gregory's Girl||Bill Forsyth ||John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Clare Grogan ||Comedy ||

The series used many regular contributors, which included Peter Kay, Clare Grogan, Dee Hepburn, Kate Thornton, Stuart Maconie, Emma B, Ice-T, Toyah Willcox, Tommy Vance, Tara Palmer-Tomkinson, Ross Noble, Jamie Theakston, and many others.
